snippet: A study of mating behavior in one species of orb-web spiders, who can mate at most twice in one lifetime, has revealed interesting patterns of male monogamy.
abstract: Klaas Welke study in journal Frontiers of Zoology reveals interesting patterns of male monogamy in one species of orb-web spiders.
lead_paragraph: A study of mating behavior in one species of orb-web spiders, who can mate at most twice in one lifetime, has revealed interesting patterns of male monogamy.

headline.print_headline: Best-Case Scenario: Two Chances to Mate
headline.seo: How Male Orb-Web Spiders, Who Can Mate at Most Twice, Choose
headline.main: Best-Case Scenario: Two Chances to Mate
